en: I gave her just what she needed.

ko: 그 사람이 정직한지는 장담 못 해.

en: I can't help doubting his honesty.
ko: 그 사람이 정직한지 의심하지 않을 수가 없어.

en: I could not find him out.
ko: 그 사람 속을 알아낼 수가 없었어.

en: I am assured of his honesty.
I have confidence that he is honest.
I am convinced of his honesty.
When I heard of his success, I wrote a letter to him.
ko: 그 사람 성공했다는 소식 듣고 편지를 썼어.

en: I am anxious for his success.
ko: 그 사람이 성공하기를 간절히 바라고 있어.

en: I am doubtful of his success.
ko: 그 사람이 성공할 수 있을지 의문이야.

en: I am envious of his success.
I had a glimpse into the negative side of his character.
ko: 그 사람 성격의 부정적인 면을 살짝 봤어.

en: I am not familiar with his character.
I cannot forget his kindness.
ko: 그 사람의 친절을 잊을 수 없어.

en: I do not like the way he treats others.
ko: 그 사람이 남들 대하는 태도가 마음에 안 들어.

en: His kindness touched my heart.
I relied on his kindness.
I would like to repay him for his kindness.
I was admiring his new car.
ko: 그 사람의 새 차를 감탄하면서 보고 있었어.

en: I didn't expect his behavior to descend to such a disagreeable level.
ko: 걔 행동이 그렇게까지 밑바닥일 줄은 몰랐어.

en: I can't understand his psychology.
I cannot help admiring his appetite.
ko: 걔 식성은 진짜 대단한 것 같아.

en: I don't like his taste in color.
ko: 난 걔 색깔 취향이 마음에 안 들어.

en: I accepted his invitation.
I dislike how he smiles.
I haven't read his novel, and my brother hasn't either.
ko: 나도 걔 소설 안 읽었고 내 동생도 안 읽었어.

en: I never read his novels without being deeply moved.
ko: 걔 소설은 읽을 때마다 정말 감동적이야.

en: I haven't read all of his novels.
ko: 걔 소설을 다 읽은 건 아니야.

en: I think little of his novel.
ko: 난 걔 소설 별로인 것 같아.

en: I think his novel is boring.
I think that his novel is boring.
I have read many of his novels in translation.
I read not only his novels but also his poems.
I am sure of his victory.
I asked for his help.
I look to him for help.
I repeated his exact statement.
ko: 걔가 한 말을 그대로 똑같이 말했어.

en: I repeated what he said word for word.
ko: 걔가 한 말을 토씨 하나 안 틀리고 그대로 전달했어.

en: I repeated what he said exactly as he had said it.
I repeated exactly what he had said.
I heard news of his departure.
I helped him with his homework.
I delayed telling him about his uncle's death as long as I could.
ko: 걔 삼촌이 돌아가셨다는 얘기를 최대한 미루다 말해줬어.

en: I forgot his address.
I know his address.
I know his address, but it's a secret.
I was able to find out his address.
I took his name and address.
I was bored with his endless sermon.
I attended his classes and learned how to draw.
ko: 걔 수업 들으면서 그림 그리는 법을 배웠어.

en: I miss his lessons so much.
I took him by the wrist.
I glanced at his letter.
I do not want to reply to his letter.
I couldn't shake off his hand.
I held fast to his hand.
I observed that his hands were unsteady.
I'm working on his car.
I demanded that they be allowed to leave.
I saw his car make a turn to the right.
I trust his executive ability.
I anticipated his question.
I'm familiar with the way he asks questions.
I am familiar with the way he asks questions.
ko: 걔가 어떤 식으로 질문하는지 잘 알아.

en: I could answer his question.
I didn't know how to answer his question.
ko: 걔 질문에 어떻게 대답해야 할지 몰랐어.

en: I was embarrassed by his rudeness.
I couldn't put up with his rudeness.
I was surprised to hear of his failure.
I dealt him a blow on the ear.
I was amazed at his abrupt resignation.
I was surprised by his resignation.
My name was called after his name.
ko: 걔 이름 다음에 내 이름이 불렸어.

en: I am indignant about the way he treated me.
ko: 걔가 나한테 한 짓 생각하면 진짜 화나.

en: I resent the way he treated me.
ko: 걔가 나한테 대했던 방식이 너무 원망스러워.

en: I was discouraged to hear of his death.
I have a suspicion about his death.
ko: 걔 죽음에 대해 좀 의심스러운 게 있어.

en: I don't support his ideas.
ko: 난 걔 생각 지지 안 해.

en: I agreed to help him in his work.
I was at a loss how to answer his unexpected question.
ko: 걔가 갑자기 질문해서 어떻게 대답할지 당황했어.

en: I am pleased with his work.
I will inherit his estate.
I inherited his estate.
I don't have much belief in his abilities.
ko: 난 걔 실력 별로 안 믿어.

en: I believe that his action was in the right.
I believe the actions that he took were right.
I sincerely hope for his happiness.
I envy him his luck.
ko: 걔 운 좋은 게 너무 부러워.

en: I gave him a present in return for his favor.
I consoled him with his favorite food.
I do not like the way he talks.
I followed him.
I followed him into his room.
I was bored with his old jokes.
I didn't believe him at all.
I interpreted his remark as a threat.
I affected not to understand what he was saying.
ko: 걔가 하는 말 못 알아듣는 척했어.

en: I pretended not to understand what he was saying.
I can't figure out what he is saying.
ko: 걔가 도대체 무슨 말을 하는 건지 모르겠어.

en: I can hardly understand what he says.
ko: 걔가 하는 말 거의 이해가 안 돼.

en: I can barely understand what he's saying.
ko: 걔가 하는 말 거의 못 알아듣겠어.

en: I took him at his word.
I couldn't for the most part make out what he said.
ko: 걔가 한 말 대부분은 이해 못 했어.

en: I dissent from what he said.
I'm opposed to what he said.
I'm going to ascertain the truth of his statement.
ko: 걔 말이 사실인지 확인해 볼 거야.

en: I plan to check to see if what he said was true or not.
ko: 걔 말이 맞는지 아닌지 확인해 볼 계획이야.

en: I could not believe his statement.
I cannot understand anything he said.
ko: 걔가 한 말 하나도 이해 안 돼.

en: I can't understand anything he said.
ko: 걔가 하는 말 무슨 소린지 하나도 모르겠어.

en: I didn't catch what he said.
I don't like what he said.
ko: 걔가 한 말 맘에 안 들어.

en: I did it the way he told me to.
I tried to listen to him carefully.
ko: 걔 말을 주의 깊게 들으려고 노력했어.

en: I believe whatever he says.
ko: 걔가 하는 말이면 뭐든 다 믿어.

en: I couldn't understand anything that he said.
ko: 걔가 하는 말 도저히 이해가 안 가더라.

en: I felt encouraged to hear what he said.
I believe what he says.
While he was talking, I guess I was absent-minded.
ko: 걔가 말하는 동안 내가 딴생각을 했나 봐.

en: I can understand him perfectly.
I couldn't understand him; I couldn't follow his way of speaking.
ko: 걔 말을 못 알아듣겠더라고. 말투를 못 따라가겠어서.

en: I could hardly understand him.
I could not make out what he meant.
ko: 걔가 무슨 뜻으로 말한 건지 모르겠더라.

en: I am very concerned about his health.
I was worried about his health.
I can bear witness to his innocence.
ko: 걔가 결백하다는 거 내가 증언해 줄 수 있어.

en: I don't approve of his decision.
I want to know the reason for his absence.
ko: 걔 왜 안 왔는지 알고 싶어.

en: I was ignorant of his plan.
I didn't know about his plan.
I agreed with his plan.
I have not the slightest interest in his plans.
I think his job resume is questionable.
I praised him for his diligence.
I grasped the entire structure of his argument.
ko: 걔 주장이 어떤 식인지 다 파악했어.

en: I lost the thread of his argument.
ko: 걔가 무슨 소리 하는지 흐름을 놓쳤어.

en: I was afraid that I might hurt his feelings.
ko: 걔 기분 상하게 할까 봐 걱정됐어.

en: I struck on an idea that could change his mind.
ko: 걔 마음을 바꿀 만한 아이디어가 떠올랐어.

en: I must live up to his expectations.
I could not come up to his expectations.
I couldn't live up to his expectations.
I couldn't meet his expectations.
I was bewildered at the sight of his strange behavior.
I know him by sight, but not by name.
I know him by sight, but I have never actually spoken to him.
ko: 얼굴은 아는데 말 섞어본 적은 없어.

en: I am sorry for his mistake.
Did I hurt his feelings?
I didn't say anything to hurt his feelings.
ko: 걔 기분 상할 만한 말은 안 했어.

en: I mused on the meaning of his painting.
ko: 걔 그림의 의미를 곰곰이 생각해 봤어.

en: I thought about the meaning of his painting.
ko: 걔 그림 의미가 뭔지 생각해 봤어.

en: I'm pointing the finger at his mistake.
I forgave his mistake.
I blamed him for his fault.
I know his family.
I remember calling at his house.
I called at his house.
I called at his house but found that he was out.
I found his house easily.
I found his house with ease.
Every time I go to his house, he is out.
ko: 걔네 집 갈 때마다 걔가 없네.

en: I classify his music as rock.
I am familiar with his music.
His music made a deep impression on me.
I was impressed by his music.
I like his music.
I was bored with his speech.
I admire his skill at driving.
I envied him his good fortune.
It has dawned on me that I mistook his intention.
ko: 걔 의도를 오해했다는 걸 이제야 깨달았어.

en: I cared little for his opinion.
ko: 걔 의견은 별로 신경 안 썼어요.

en: I don't make much of his opinion.
ko: 걔 의견을 그렇게 중요하게 생각 안 해요.

en: I couldn't agree with his opinion.
I did so at his request.
I went to the hospital to inquire after his health.
I went to the hospital to ask about his health.
ko: 걔 상태가 어떤지 물어보러 병원에 갔어요.

en: I asked after him.
I brushed by him while running.
I went over his report, but couldn't find any mistakes.
ko: 걔 보고서를 검토해 봤는데, 틀린 걸 못 찾았어요.

en: I'm looking over his report.
I found myself listening to his records.
ko: 나도 모르게 걔 레코드를 듣고 있더라고요.

en: I can't trust such a man as he.
I cannot trust a person like that.
I can't trust people like him.
I listened to some of his records.
I interpreted what he said in French into Japanese.
ko: 걔가 프랑스어로 말한 걸 일본어로 통역해 줬어요.

en: I want to have his only daughter for my wife.
I want to sing to his piano accompaniment.
ko: 걔 피아노 반주에 맞춰서 노래하고 싶어요.

en: I often visited his house.
I will do anything for him.
He has no friends besides me.
I held his sleeve.
I was deeply affected by his speech.
I couldn't catch on to the joke he told us.
I couldn't understand his joke.
I didn't get his joke.
I can't forgive him for what he did.
ko: 걔가 한 짓은 용서가 안 돼요.

en: He doesn't believe me at all.
ko: 걔는 내 말을 전혀 안 믿어요.

en: I regard him as a man of character.
I cannot help thinking about him.
ko: 걔 생각을 안 할 수가 없네요.

en: I know him like a book.
I like him, but at the same time I don't really trust him.
ko: 걔가 좋긴 한데, 동시에 또 별로 믿음은 안 가요.

en: I saw his mother scold him.
ko: 걔네 엄마가 걔 혼내시는 걸 봤어요.

en: I would like to meet his father.
I may as well stay alone as keep him company.
ko: 걔랑 같이 있느니 차라리 혼자 있는 게 낫겠어요.

en: I cannot help laughing at his odd manner.
ko: 걔의 이상한 태도에 웃음을 참을 수가 없었어요.

en: I held him by the collar.
I can't forget his kindness.
ko: 걔가 베풀어 준 친절을 잊을 수가 없어요.

en: I landed him a blow on the chin.
I punched him in the chin.
I punched his jaw.
I have read twice as many books as he has.
ko: 난 걔보다 책을 두 배는 더 많이 읽었어요.

en: I could not speak to him.
I meet with him once every six months.
I told him to come.
I told him to keep his promise.
I asked him if he would go there the next day.
ko: 걔한테 내일 거기 갈 거냐고 물어봤어요.

en: I am not acquainted with him.
I waved him back.
I called him a coward to his face.
I complained to him face to face.
I asked him to go there tomorrow.
I asked him what his name was.
I was trying to tell him what had really happened, but he cut me short.
ko: 진짜 무슨 일이 있었는지 말해주려 했는데 걔가 내 말을 끊어버렸어.

en: I gave him a few books.
I thanked him for lending me a book.
I gave him a book.
I will take my revenge on him.
I was bound to answer him.
I gave my cold to him.
I told him to leave the room.
I do not want him to be careless.
I owe him $100.
I asked him about his new book.
ko: 걔한테 새로 나온 책에 대해 물어봤어.

en: I told him, once for all, that I would not marry him.
ko: 걔한테 결혼 안 한다고 딱 잘라 말했어.

en: I told him that he was wrong.
I beat him on points.
I congratulated him on passing the entrance exam.
ko: 걔한테 입학 시험 합격한 거 축하한다고 말해줬어.

en: I whispered to him to come in.
I told him not to be late again.
I could not help feeling sympathy with him.
ko: 걔가 안타깝다는 생각이 들 수밖에 없었어.

en: I gave him some good advice about buying land.
ko: 땅 사는 거에 대해서 걔한테 좋은 조언 좀 해줬어.

en: I called him, but the line was busy.
I called him up and asked his schedule.
I telephoned him the message.
I forgot to give him the message.
I met him on the street.
I can run fast enough to catch up with him.
ko: 걔를 따라잡을 수 있을 정도로 빨리 달릴 수 있어.

en: I haven't met him in person, but I know of him.
ko: 걔를 직접 본 적은 없는데 누군지는 알아.

en: I wrote him a long letter, but he sent me no reply.
ko: 걔한테 장문의 편지를 썼는데 답장이 없었어.

en: I turned to him for advice.
I gave him advice, to which he paid no attention.
ko: 걔한테 조언을 해줬는데 걔는 귓등으로도 안 듣더라.

en: I gave him some advice.
I requested him to keep me informed.
I answered for him.
I gave him much trouble.
I caused him a lot of trouble.
I bid against him.
I chose him a nice tie.
I claimed damages against him.
I am in debt to him for 1,000 yen.
I remember meeting that man before.
ko: 저 사람 전에 만났던 거 기억나.

en: I explained it to him.
I don't want to see him at all.
I explained it to him, only to make him confused.
ko: 걔한테 설명해줬는데 오히려 더 헷갈려 하더라고.

en: I told him to be quiet.
I congratulated him on his success.
I gave some books to him.
I had not a little difficulty in bringing the truth home to him.
I confided my troubles to him.
I furnished him with food.
I was all the more angry because I was laughed at by him.
I made him sweep the floor.
I gave him what little information I had.
ko: 내가 아는 정보라도 걔한테 다 알려줬어.

en: I appeal to him for his advice.
I thanked him for helping me.
I asked him to help me.
I asked him if he would help me.
I besought him to help me.
I intend him to help me with my homework.
ko: 걔한테 내 숙제 좀 도와달라고 하려고.

en: I had him do my homework.
I gave him my address.
I will get him to come and help me.
I put handcuffs on him.
I have put off writing to him till today.
ko: 걔한테 편지 쓰는 거 오늘까지 미뤘어.

en: I had the letter written by him.
I had him write the letter for me.
I asked him if he had got my letter.
I suggested to him.
I think it's better not to lend him a hand.
ko: 걔는 안 도와주는 게 나을 것 같아.

en: I had him wash the car.
I got him to repair my car.
ko: 걔한테 내 차 좀 고쳐달라고 했어.

en: I asked him to drive me home.
I reminded him of his interview with the president.
ko: 사장님이랑 면접 있는 거 걔한테 다시 말해줬어.

en: I asked him a question.
I asked a question of him.
I regret having been rude to him.
I was disappointed in him.
I could not persuade him of my honesty.
ko: 내가 정직하다는 걸 걔한테 설득시키지 못했어.

en: I got him to fix my bicycle.
ko: 걔한테 내 자전거 좀 고쳐달라고 했어.

en: I had him mend my watch.
ko: 걔한테 내 시계 좀 고쳐달라고 했어.

en: I had my watch mended by him.
I had him repair my watch.
ko: 걔한테 내 시계 좀 수리해달라고 했어.

en: I had him fix my watch.
ko: 걔한테 내 시계 좀 고쳐달라고 시켰어.

en: It was demanded that I tell him the truth.
I challenged him to a game.
I would like him to stay with us.
I tried to convince him of my innocence.
I got him to mend my shoes.
ko: 걔한테 내 신발 좀 고쳐달라고 했어.

en: I discouraged him from marrying me.
I told him about our school.
I asked him if I could read them.
I paid him the money due to him.
I paid him four dollars.
I agree with him.
I bought him a magazine.
I lent him a magazine.
I told him that I would do my best.
I advise him to come back at once.
I must study hard in order to keep up with him.
ko: 걔 따라잡으려면 공부 열심히 해야 돼.

en: I owe him 50,000 yen.
I made him open the door.
